intro: Potentilla novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with woody stems and compound leaves. Its botanical features include five-petaled flowers and a preference for well-drained, sunny habitats. It is often found in moist, forested areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
